extendedIngredients.name: dried currants
extendedIngredients.originalString: 3 Tablespoons currants, raisins, or other dried fruit

extendedIngredients.aisle: Nut butters, Jams, and Honey;Health Foods
extendedIngredients.name: honey
extendedIngredients.originalString: ½ cup honey (You can adjust this down, if you prefer it less sweet; you may also use pure maple syrup.)
metaInformation: (You can adjust this down, if you prefer it less ; you may also use maple syrup.)

extendedIngredients.name: oil
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 Tablespoons oil, your choice (I use avocado or coconut oil.)

extendedIngredients.name: quinoa flakes
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 cups quinoa flakes (I like Ancient Harvest brand, which are available at many supermarkets, Whole Foods or online.)
metaInformation: (I like Ancient Harvest brand, which are available at many supermarkets, Foods or online.)

extendedIngredients.name: unsweetened coconut milk
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 cup unsweetened coconut milk (or other milk)

recipes.title: One-Dish Baked Quinoa
recipes.instructions: Preheat your oven to 350F.In a 2-quart glass baking dish, combine all ingredients and stir.(Yes, in the dish. With no greasing. Just put it right in there and stir until it is well-blended.)Bake for approximately 30 minutes. (The edges will have a slight golden color, and the center will appear to be set and have a drier appearance when the quinoa is done.)Allow dish to cool 15 minutes then serve with fresh fruit, yogurt or your favorite breakfast foods.

steps.step: Preheat your oven to 350F.In a 2-quart glass baking dish, combine all ingredients and stir.(Yes, in the dish. With no greasing. Just put it right in there and stir until it is well-blended.)

Bake for approximately 30 minutes. (The edges will have a slight golden color, and the center will appear to be set and have a drier appearance when the quinoa is done.)Allow dish to cool 15 minutes then serve with fresh fruit, yogurt or your favorite breakfast foods.
